abstracts.cdata!:
The goal of the Second Rural and Main
            Roads Project for Guatemala is to contribute reducing rural
            poverty and build social cohesion by improving and
            maintaining access in rural areas to markets, schools,
            health centers and other social and economic infrastructure
            through broadened community participation. The closing date
            for project will be extended from December 31, 2011 until
            September 30, 2012. The extension is necessary to support
            the implementation of the Corrective Action Plan to
            completion and to thus resolve all outstanding cases of
            involuntary resettlement. This includes principally the
            execution of contracts currently in the procurement stage to
            reconstruct houses and structures affected by the secondary
            road improvements carried out in Huehuetenango department.
            The extension will also support the completion of ongoing
            contracts for tertiary road and bridge improvements which
            will contribute towards a satisfactory outcome for the
            project as well as the completion of an impact evaluation study.
